answers.answer: Don't eat nuttin with sugar cause that's what makes it high ..
Don't eat too much rice, fruits, and things with high sugar content.

I failed my first and passed my second.  All I can say is avoid carbs.  No sugar.  No fruit.  Nothing that will turn into glucose.  I think I ate green beans for supper for a week before the second test.  Lean meat like chicken breasts.  I read on here that someone said to try to walk when you do the three hour test because it helps your body use up that blood sugar. Good luck!
i also the first time it was too hight because i had an large orange juice five minutes before maybe if u had something sweet before had something to do so u could get it high

Honestly you can't trick this test. I had an egg and granola bar for my 1 hour test and failed. Went for my 3 hour test on a Monday morning and had lemonade and cake from my baby shower and passed. If you read any creditable gestational diabetes site, they will all tell you to eat like you normally do. If you have gestational diabetes, you want to find out so you can do what is best for you and your baby. Not to trick the test up so you can pass, which won't happen anyways because you can't trick it. Not trying to be rude at all. I just get tired of seeing people posting about this and people leafing them to believe that they can find a way around it.

I just recently got diagnosed with gestational diabetes  and I've been staying away of carbs I can have 1-3 servings of carbs for breakfast and 3-4 servings for lunch and dinner and then I eat protein, lots veggies  with my dish so I can get some what full:)

question: Today early in the Am i went in for my glucouse test n i failed. The nurse told me it was too high .. what should i eat n wat shouldnt i?  Go in next week for another appoiment
title: glucouse test
